page.title: 02Telscombe Village's History
page.content: Telscombe is mentioned in the Domesday book. Telscombe's first name was Tittlescombe.Telscombe was the capital of the Hundreds of Lewes, it was given by Eldred brother of Edmund to the monastary of Winchester.Most people worked on farms. There used to be a windmill at Telscombe where farmers took their corn to be thrashed.In 1821, 113 people lived there.Mr.Gorham the squire helped the villagers by laying on mains water and electricity. at the turn of the century. In 1902 one of his horses - Shannon Lass won the Grand Natonal. When he died all his land went to Brighton Corporation under a trust.According to this the vicar of the village church of St.Lawrence was expected to be non-teatotal and to be a smoker. Jenny Mayhew age 9
